description: From Middle English fruitefull, equivalent to fruit +‎ -ful. Compare Dutch vruchtvol, German fruchtvoll, Swedish fruktfull.

adjectives.description: fruitful (comparative more fruitful, superlative most fruitful)

entries.meaning: Favourable to the growth of fruit or useful vegetation; not barren.
Being productive in any sense; yielding benefits.
examples: The extra work in the office turned out to be fruitful after all—I got promoted
